BJMC Global is a service-disabled, veteran-owned small business specializing in general management consulting services and facilities support services. Over the past 2 decades, we’ve designed, managed, and delivered complex, challenging projects throughout the world, including in post-disaster environments, in active war zones, and in some of the world’s most remote and austere locations.

BJMC Global is currently seeking an experienced and qualified **Project Automation Specialist** to support our team working on a Department of Energy (DOE) project in the United States. We're looking for specialists who can overcome challenges and complete projects in any environment. This role will work closely with our engineering team and must have a working knowledge of federal (including DOE), state, and local codes and standards applicable to engineering design (nuclear and other areas).

If you're someone who can take direction, but doesn’t always need to be told what to do, then we want to hear from you.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

- Provide intermediate level of end user project support, project configuration, or special project modifications required.

- Provide technical configuration and office support for engineering design technology in conjunction with the Project Automation Manager.

- Employ effective knowledge sharing behaviors in the use of knowledge management portals and communities.

- Work with the Project Information Manager (PIM) to analyze any technical implementation or configuration issues for engineering design systems.

- Collaborate with a more senior Project Automation Specialist (PAS) to analyze and evaluate technology support and implementation requirements.

- Provide routine end user office support, project setup and configuration or special project modifications required for the automation technology utilized.

- Assist Information Technology (IT) in evaluating technology impact to infrastructure and systems.

- Analyze and make independent recommendations regarding solutions to problems with varying complexity in accordance with organization and/or project objectives and guidelines.

- Organize and prioritize a variety of projects and multiple tasks in an effective and timely manner, set priorities, and meet deadlines.

- Plan and organize own work assignments, as well as carry out tasks from management staff.

- Maintain compliance with all applicable policies, procedures, and global standards.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

- Must have four (4) year degree in applicable field of study and seven (7) years of work-related experience or (11) years if non-degreed.

- Ability to communicate effectively with audiences that include but are not limited to management, coworkers, clients, vendors, contractors, and visitors.

- Job related technical knowledge necessary to complete the job.

- Ability to learn and apply knowledge of applicable local, state/province, and federal/national statutes and guidelines.

- Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner.

- Basic knowledge of Information Technology for Desktop/laptop environment and general office tools; Infrastructure (Wide Area Network (WAN), Local Area Network (LAN), telecommunications, etc.); Electronic security and governance; Electronic communications; Network operations and support; Software development, implementation, and support; Knowledge of Automation technology and systems integration including overall knowledge of the tool integration capabilities and discipline integration needs.

- High level of aptitude in MS Excel, Microstation V8 or Connect Edition, Programming (VBA or C# or VB.net), PowerShell and automation scripting, Windows CMD.

- Vendor certification in Automation/Information Technology/Information Management technologies a plus.

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:**

- Must be good team players and able to work well with others in pursuit of accomplishing program objectives.

- Must have excellent oral and written communication skills.

- DOE requires that all workers on this project must be U.S. citizens.

- Must pass background investigation and drug screening.

**HOW TO APPLY**

Interested candidates should provide a current resume clearly describing relevant past experience. Our onboarding team will review your resume and if you meet the qualifications and requirements of the position, we’ll contact you to discuss next steps.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $55.00 - $65.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you authorized to work on this project per the Department of Energy (DOE) requirement that all staff must be U.S. Citizens?
* For the remote position, are you willing to perform up to 2 weeks per month of travel (fully paid) to project office in Greenville, SC?
* Which of the following do you have a high level of aptitude? MS Excel, AutoCAD, Revit, Smart 3D, Microstation V8 or Connect Edition, Programming (VBA or C# or VB.net), PowerShell and automation scripting, Windows CMD.
* Do you have a 4-year degree in Information Technology or an equivalent field?

Work Location: Remote

title: Head of Data Process Control
description:
**If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us**
============================================================


In a world of cloud complexity, NetApp simplifies. Our customers are looking for a more unified and secure multicloud experience, and we provide the services, infrastructure and expertise they need to achieve it.



If you want to have a real impact, NetApp is the place for you. You’ll make a difference—while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Who are we? Forward-thinking technology people with a heart. Join us.


**Head of Data Process Control**
================================


Remote - US


**Job category:** Business Operations


**Job ID:** 125399-en\\_US


**About NetApp**


We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?

**"At NetApp, we fully embrace and advance a diverse, inclusive global workforce with a culture of belonging that leverages the backgrounds and perspectives of all employees, customers, partners, and communities to foster a higher performing organization."** -George Kurian, CEO

**Job summary**
---------------


This position will support the analysis, planning, design, implementation, and evaluation of key data projects to help NetApp meet and exceed growth goals. In this role you will work directly with data and other functional leads to understand the business needs and to drive efficiencies by optimizing and documenting the processes.


This position will be located in the eastern time zone of the US.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Act as a global liaison with GTM Operations in understanding, facilitating, and streamlining process for more efficient sales reporting
* Document and manage a data process repository, coordinating with center of excellence teams
* Establish controls to ensure accurate process execution and training with stakeholders
* Manage data definitions and central repository and communicate to stakeholders
* Responsible for implementing improvements and measuring the results
* Focus on improved organizational productivity and operational efficiency
* Create flowcharts of existing processes, identify pain points and develop solutions
* Research possible solutions (in cooperation with IT, Finance, and Sales Operations)
* Identify, conceptualize and design data process and system improvements
* Utilize change management techniques to ensure the improvements are sustained
* Play a key role in driving data governance and definitions across various cross-functional teams
**Job requirements**
--------------------

* Experience leading data process improvements
* Must have experience with Sales Operations
* Highly entrepreneurial and able to operate independently with minimum supervision
* Working on project teams with a focus on desired outcomes
* Ability to manage projects and work independently across various improvements
* Ability to successfully interface with all levels and areas of the organization
* Establish close working relationships with key areas of interface
* Lead teams of cross functional business partners to effectively determine scope of data and process improvement and business impact
* Ability to quantify impact to process metrics and financials
* Build consensus and support for chosen solution(s)
* Strong verbal and written communications
* Have highly developed problem-solving and change management skills
* Ability to analyze complex data to draw supportable conclusions and recommendations
* Heavily results-oriented; a strong track record in meeting and/or exceeding goals
* Proven expertise in data automation, metrics, process governance, and productivity
**Education**
-------------

* 15+ years of relevant experience and a Bachelor’s degree in business or related field; master’s degree preferred
* 8+ years of experience with a proven track record of success leading process improvement efforts
* 5+ years of experience in analytical functions
* Strategic and tactical skills with great cross-collaboration abilities
* Experience implementing cross-organizational reports and dashboards
* Enthusiastic, detail-oriented, results-oriented, and team-focused
* Experience and certification as a Lean Six Sigma Black Belt is a plus


#Sponsor

**Did you know…**  

Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they’re 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you.

**Why NetApp?**


In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world’s biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.  

  

We expect a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. We also offer financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.  

  

If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**


NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification.

**USA and Canada Residents Only:**

The base salary hiring wage range for this position which the Company reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position in the specified geographic areas or locations is $187,000 - $251,000. Final compensation will be dependent on various factors relevant to the position and candidate such as geographical location, candidate qualifications, certifications, relevant job-related work experience, education, skillset, and other relevant business and organizational factors, consistent with applicable law. In addition, the position may include some of the following comprehensive benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, 401(K), Paid Time off (PTO), sick time, leave of absence as per the FMLA and other relevant leave laws, Company bonus/commission, employee stock purchase plan, and/or restricted stocks (RSU’s).

title: Program Manager
description:
Overview:

Goldbelt Frontier is committed to providing support for a range of health technology management operations, projects, and services across the government and commercial industries. Frontier collaborates with clients and partners with other businesses to ensure that the right solution with the right people is delivered to meet the client’s needs. Many senior project managers and business analysts are subject matter experts in their respective fields. Frontier understands how to support multiple stakeholders to aid in developing and implementing national policies, strategies, and doctrine. **Summary:**
Goldbelt is seeking a Senior Program Manager to drive the successful implementation of Oracle Cloud Supply Chain solutions within the Indian Health Service (IHS), collaborating closely with the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and other federal agencies in the healthcare supply chain ecosystem. This leadership position involves establishing and leading the Program Management Office (PMO) to ensure effective governance, standardization, and oversight throughout the project lifecycle, managing and driving the successful implementation.

  

This is a hybrid position with possibility of being remote.
Responsibilities:
**Essential Job Functions:**

* **Program Leadership and Governance**
* Establish and lead the Program Management Office (PMO) to provide governance, standardization, and oversight for the Oracle Cloud Supply Chain project.
* Develop and implement program management policies and procedures to ensure adherence to best practices and federal regulations.
* **Comprehensive Program Planning**
* Develop and execute a comprehensive roadmap and detailed project plans for the Oracle Cloud Supply Chain implementation, considering timelines, dependencies, resources, and deliverables.
* Ensure alignment of program objectives with organizational goals and federal requirements.
* **Task and Activity Management**
* Manage day-to-day tracking, execution, and resolution of program tasks and activities.
* Initiate corrective actions when necessary to keep the program on track and within scope.
* **RAID Log Management**
* Efficiently manage the Risks, Assumptions, Issues, and Dependencies (RAID) log.
* Identify, assess, and mitigate potential program challenges, developing necessary contingency plans.
* **Contract and Scope Management**
* Manage the program contract based on the agreed-upon scope defined in the Statement of Work.
* Control scope creep, ensure clear change requests, and assess their impacts against program timelines.
* **Reporting and Escalation**
* Prepare and deliver regular program reporting, escalating any issues to the Program Steering Committee as appropriate and in a timely manner.
* Ensure transparency and open communication channels with stakeholders.
* **Backlog Management**
* Develop and maintain a backlog of product enhancements to meet both tactical needs and strategic goals.
* Prioritize backlog items based on business value and program priorities.
* **Team Support and Oversight**
* Provide counseling, coaching, and support for delivery teams.
* Foster a collaborative and efficient working environment, ensuring the team is aligned with program objectives.
* Work closely and collaboratively with subcontractor(s) if any, and the clients, to ensure success.
* **Financial Management**
* Manage program financials, including the development of financial plans.
* Monitor and control program budget, ensuring effective allocation of resources.


Qualifications:
**Necessary Knowledge and Skills:**

* In-depth knowledge of program/project management methodologies and tools, including risk management and RAID log practices in large-scale implementations.
* Successful delivery of multiple end-to-end Oracle Cloud Supply Chain projects.
* Knowledge of supply chain processes including Order Management, Inventory Management, Sourcing and Procurement, Warehouse Management, and Cost Management.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including proven ability to lead work in collaborative multi-vendor environment.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* At a minimum of 5 years of proven experience as a Program Manager, specifically leading complex supply chain-related projects in healthcare settings and/or federal organizations.
* Experience with change management practices and methodologies to drive user adoption and organizational change.
* US Citizen who holds or is eligible to gain clearance to work in federal government environments, ensuring compliance with necessary security protocols and regulations.

**Preferred Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Systems or related field. Master’s degree a plus
* Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.
* Oracle certifications, such as Oracle Certified Implementation Specialist (OCIS) or Oracle Certified Professional (OCP), are highly desirable.
* IHS IT Program and/or Project Experience.
* Deep understanding of Oracle Cloud Supply Chain modules.
* Experience in the medical supplies procurement and distribution industries.
* Experience working in Federal environment, with familiarity with Federal regulations and compliance frameworks.


The salary range for the position is $150,000.00 - $200,000.00 annually.

 **Pay and Benefits**
At Goldbelt, we value and reward our team's dedication and hard work. We provide a competitive base salary commensurate with your qualifications and experience. As an employee, you'll enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company matching, tax-deferred savings options, supplementary benefits, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.

title: SailPoint SME Senior Consultant (Remote)
description:
**Work you'll do**  

* Utilize IAM (Identity and Access Management) programs to enable federal, state, local and/or higher education clients to protect against digital identity risks.
* Provide appropriate access to applications, systems, and data with advanced authentication.
* Oversee the spread of information with privileged access management.
* Multitask and switch gears to meet changing priorities and tasks to accomplish goals/objectives.
* Work in a distributed team environment where team members are spread across numerous locations and often communicate virtually to support clients IAM applications.
* Identify and evaluate complex business and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for internal control improvement
* Evaluate and support complex IAM and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for internal control improvement.
* Responsible to design, install, implement, architect, configure and maintain one or more Identity & Access Management products such as SailPoint in a client environment.
* Communicate the IAM aspects of both the production support and maintenance at the technical and functional level to maintain or resolve a technical situation.
* Facilitate use of technology-based tools or methodologies to review, design and/or implement products and services.

  

**The team:**  

  

From our centers, we work with Deloitte consultants to design, develop and build solutions to help clients reimagine, reshape and rewire the competitive fabric of entire industries. Our centers house a multitude of specialists, ranging from systems designers, architects and integrators, to creative digital experts, to cyber risk and human capital professionals. All work together on diverse projects from advanced pre-configured solutions and methodologies, to brand-building and campaign management. We are a unique blend of skills and experiences, yet we underline the value of each individual, providing customized career paths, fostering innovation and knowledge development with a focus on quality.  

  

**Qualifications**  

  

**Required:**
  

* Minimum Bachelor's Degree or above .
* 3+ years of experience with the following: Installation, integration, and deployment of SailPoint in client environments. Identity & Access Governance including Role based access control, access request and certification.
* 3+ years of experience with the following: Managing projects through the full system development lifecycle. Developing, implementing or architecting information systems. Technical architecture experience integrating identity management, access management and access governance software into clients' infrastructure and applications.
* Must be legally authorized to work in the United States with no sponsorship required now or at anytime in the future
* Annual travel up to 15%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve
* Ability to obtain & maintain the required security clearance

  

**Preferred:**  

* 1+ years work experience Active Directory and Radiant Logic in relation to SailPoint IAM.
* 1+ years experience supporting Federal IT projects that integrate multiple ICAM/IAM technologies. Experience with onboarding and managing privileged accounts across network environments.
* Prior professional services or federal consulting experience

title: Manager, Sales Engineering - Technical Specialist
description:
SailPoint is seeking a Solution Engineering Manager to support our AMS Technical Specialist team. The Technical Specialist team is responsible for delivering evaluations of the different SailPoint solutions. You will play a critical role in growing SailPoint’s business by building and leading a high performing team of Sales Engineers. Our Sales Engineers play a vital role in evaluating, demonstrating, and communicating the value of SailPoint’s products and thought leadership to our prospective customers in the Identity Security market.
Within 30 Days: Onboarded and met all team members and sales leaders the territory supports.
Within 60 Days: Familiar with business and top opportunities and established cadences with peers, sales, and team members.
Within 90 Days: Complete product training and into rhythm with team members, peers, and leadership.
Within 1-Year: Continue in full partnership with sales leaders and trust of your team while achieving budget for the sales territories supported.
WHAT YOU WILL DO* Hire, coach and drive an outstanding Sales Engineering team to deliver against assigned goals
* Manage individual and team performance ensuring that we are taking the necessary actions to maintain high levels of performance
* Demonstrate analytical and problem-solving skills, and strong management consulting skills to influence thinking or gain acceptance of multiple customer constituencies
* Work to improve the SailPoint sales methodology and processes effectively, including development of product presentations and evaluations tailored to our prospects requirements and tuned to suit the level and nature of the audience
* Assess gaps in evolving training needs and then create and implement programs to improve sales, product and technology skills of the Sales Engineering team
* Work with Regional Sales directors on evaluation planning, strategy and sales call activity
* Provide timely and insightful input back to other corporate functions, particularly field sales, product management and marketing
* Manage relationships with product teams & decision makers both internally and externally


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR* Bachelor of Arts or Science in Computer Science or equivalent degree/experience, preferred, not required
* Previous experience, 5+ years as a sales engineering manager and 5+ years as a sales engineer
* Excellent communication skills including experience speaking to a technical and business audiences
* The ideal candidate will already have a good understanding of the solutions, market dynamics and best practices in the Identity Governance market


About SailPoint
SailPoint, the leader in enterprise identity security, brings the Power of Identity to customers around the world. SailPoint’s open identity platform gives organizations the power to enter new markets, scale their workforces, embrace new technologies, innovate faster and compete on a global basis. As both an industry pioneer and market leader in identity governance, SailPoint delivers security, operational efficiency and compliance to enterprises with complex IT environments. SailPoint's customers are among the world’s largest companies in virtually every industry, including: 9 of the top banks, 7 of the top retail brands, 6 of the top healthcare providers, 6 of the top property and casualty insurance providers, and 6 of the top pharmaceutical companies.
#LI-REMOTE #LI-AS1
SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: EPICOR Operations Analyst
description:
Lincoln Electric is the world leader in the engineering, design, and manufacturing of advanced arc welding solutions, automated joining, assembly and cutting systems, plasma and oxy-fuel cutting equipment, and has a leading global position in brazing and soldering alloys. Lincoln is recognized as the Welding Expert™ for its leading materials science, software development, automation engineering, and application expertise, which advance customers' fabrication capabilities to help them build a better world. Headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio, Lincoln Electric is a $4.2B publicly traded company (NASDAQ:LECO) with over 11,000 employees around the world, with operations in 71 manufacturing and automation system integration locations across 21 countries and maintains a worldwide network of distributors and sales offices serving customers in over 160 countries.

  

Location: **Remote - Ohio** - **Fort Loramie**, **OH**, **United States (US)**  

Employment Status: **Salary Full-Time**  

Function: **Information Technology**  

Req ID: **24280**

 **Candidate can reside anywhere in the United States**

 **PURPOSE:** This position is responsible for overall support and optimization of all operations related processes implemented throughout Lincoln Electric’s Automation businesses using Epicor’s operations modules (Sales, Service, Supply Chain, Planning and Scheduling, Production, etc.) This involves continuous collaboration with the global Automation operations teams and an extended group of internal (and possibly external) stakeholders to identify, prioritize and implement process enhancements, and to readily address and resolve production support issues as they arise.

 **JOB DESCRIPTION (DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILTIES):**

* Provide primary oversight for Epicor’s operations related modules, including Sales & Service Management, Supply Chain, Planning & Scheduling, and Production, from solution definition and specification, to implementation to production support and optimization.
* Serve as primary business analyst for Epicor’s operational processes to identify ways to continuously improve them through the application of Epicor capabilities and associated technologies, striving for operational efficiency and effectiveness.
* Translate business requirements into functional requirements and document these in functional specifications to facilitate Epicor enhancements.
* Manage internal and external relationships with key partners and stakeholders including Automation site operations teams, local leadership, consulting partners, and Corporate IT.
* For larger initiatives, develop project plans including project scope, approach, Epicor architecture, task list, staffing requirements, and then execute according to plan.
* Assist with defining testing procedures to be conducted when validating new system enhancements/changes.
* Ensure all system changes are clearly documented and tracked within Corporate IT’s SIR tracking database.
* Provide guidance to Corporate IT Security Team on Epicor application security as they process Epicor user security requests.
* Work with the Automation business team to actively manage, prioritize, and implement a continuous queue of operations related Epicor system enhancement requests, tracking requests within Corporate IT’s Quip Demand Request Tracking Log.
* Work with Corporate IT Information Governance as required to respond to inquiries from internal or external auditors related to annual Epicor SOX audit requirements.
* Prepare documentation of current business processes and identify process gaps and shortcomings as opportunities for improvement.
* Prepare and maintain documentation on Epicor best practices within the Lincoln Business System framework, and strive for uniform conformance to these best practices across LE’s Automation businesses.
* Document time spent on specific projects using Lincoln’s time tracking tools.
* Assume additional responsibilities and perform special projects as needed or directed in support of Lincoln Electric’s strategic goals.

**BASIC REQUIREMENTS:**

* 2+ years’ experience (***Analyst II***) / 4+ years’ experience (***Specialist I***) with the Epicor ERP system, either as an end-user or in a consultative capacity, with in-depth knowledge of its operations modules including Sales & Service Management, Supply Chain, Planning & Scheduling, and Production.
* Bachelor’s or Associate’s degree, preferably in Operations, Supply Chain, Information Technology, Engineering, or related business/technical field.
* Preferred minimum of 1 year of experience serving as business process functional analyst.
* Working knowledge of best practices as related to conducting business using Epicor ERP in a manufacturing environment, preferably in an Engineer-to-Order business context.
* Highly motivated, goal oriented team player with strong oral and written communication skills.
* Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with, train, and collaborate with business users and functional experts, IT and technical resources to ensure the IT needs of the business are being met.
* Analytical expertise to identify and resolve problems by recommending and implementing creative solutions.
* Demonstrated ability to plan, organize, and execute projects of reasonable complexity.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, PowerPoint. Project preferred.
* Ability to give and receive directions/instructions, and to leverage available resources to translate ambiguous or indefinite directions into specific, actionable steps to achieve goals.
* Willingness to pursue continued professional development through formal, informal and on-the-job training to maintain keen knowledge of Epicor capabilities, technologies, and best practices.
* Knowledge of Engineer-to-Order processes in a manufacturing setting is highly desirable.
* Ability to create reports using Epicor tools, SQL queries, and/or data extraction a plus.
* Knowledge of working in Kinetic Application a plus

**Environmental, Health & Safety (EH&S)**

* Understand the Company’s EHS Policy and how it relates to this job.
* Be aware of OSHA & EPA laws and regulations as well as the Company’s Plant Rules and Regulations that pertain to this job.
* Work in a safe and environmentally friendly manner and observe all company EHS procedures.
* Know that the company EHS procedures are located on the ISO drive.
* Immediately notify the Supervisor if there is any safety hazard, any equipment not operating correctly, or if there are any questions regarding EHS procedures.
* Attend required EHS training

 **Physical demands and work environment:** The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Physical demands: While performing duties of job, employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Repetition with activity; computer work. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
* Work environment: The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

 **ISO-14001**: Complies with ISO 14001, and other relevant standards. Support, implement and understand the intent of the EMS policy. Participates with ISO-14001 as required.

 **Lincoln Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer.** We are committed to promoting equal employment opportunity for applicants, without regard to their race, color, national origin, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions, including, but not limited to, lactation), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, and any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Systems Architect
description:
Want to hear a secret? Consumer plastics are recycled less than you may think, but Cyclyx is changing that. We're not your average recycling company-we're a groundbreaking plastic management company focused on making more plastics recyclable.


Cyclyx brings together industry players to actively engage in developing advanced plastic recycling systems. We work closely with partners to gather and process large amounts of waste plastic to meet specific needs. This approach increases plastic recycling and aims to break the cycle of low recycling rates.

*Here is your chance to be an exciting part of the solution!*

**About Cyclyx**


Cyclyx International LLC is a joint venture formed in January 2021, whose current members include Agilyx ASA, ExxonMobil, and LyondellBasell. It is focused on addressing the global plastic waste problem. You can be part of a team that will pioneer new technology and processes to drive the current recycling rate of waste plastics from 10% to 90%. Now is an exciting time for the rapidly growing Cyclyx business and a great place to build your career. So why wait for the future when you can create it?


To scale the technology, Cyclyx has developed a unique plastic processing facility called the Cyclyx Circularity Center (CCC) to process waste plastics with new methodologies and has also developed a series of landfill deferral programs to divert waste plastics away from landfills. The innovations Cyclyx has developed provide a disruptive platform to the existing recycling industry, and we are looking for highly motivated, creative, and resourceful leaders to join our mission.

**Position Summary**


The Senior Systems Architect reports to Cyclyx's VP of Information Technology and Integration. The position is responsible for thoroughly understanding the organization's server and infrastructure, architecture, standards, future technology plans, and recommend emerging trends for hardware and software infrastructure according to their research. A qualified candidate will need to analyze and provide reviews on the magnitude of shortcomings and shortages in information systems, approaches to mitigate risks, resolve security alerts, and pre-empt possible adverse outcomes of identified weaknesses. The successful candidate will be a technology specialist with superb interpersonal skills, a passion for problem-solving, and an eagerness to immerse themselves in the business and drive solutions. A business-first, human-centric mindset is crucial. The candidate will work with the Cyclyx IT team to execute solutions in support of the company's business needs.


This role is most appropriate for an architect with broad technical capabilities who would be adept at developing a network topology one day and researching data governance principles the next. Candidates must demonstrate an ability to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels and skills to capture processes, translate business requirements into technical requirements, and collaboratively drive product selection or design efforts from those requirements. This candidate should be skilled in developing reference architecture and selecting appropriate technologies.


Prior experience working in a manufacturing environment is a must; specific experience with ERP, SCADA, Business Intelligence, and warehousing systems is strongly preferred.

 **Responsibilities**

* Create documentation such as reference architecture, design specifications, and design rationale to help other team members understand the design decision process.
* Research emerging technologies that could impact the system being designed.
* Develop conceptual models of how users interact with systems, including how data will be governed and processed.
* Recommend new technology solutions to meet business goals and objectives.
* Review existing systems to determine how they can be improved or updated.
* Working with designers to create reference architecture showing how system components work together.
* Identify security risks and advise/execute mitigation strategies.
* Determine hardware and software specifications for systems being designed.
* Serve as a liaison between the IT team and other departments within the company.
* Work directly with the business to capture existing business processes and workflows and design new ones.
* Seek opportunities for continuous improvement through automation and other methods to improve the quality and efficiency of business and IT processes.
* Analyze the impact of proposed business and system changes and advise on risk mitigation approaches.
* Serve as the key stakeholder in the implementation of new technology.
* Collaborate with Cyclyx IT in procuring, implementing, and operationalizing new business systems.

 **Qualifications**

* 4-yr. College bachelor's degree in a relative field of study or equitable, relevant work experience as needed to meet the requirements of the role
* Ten years of manufacturing industry experience as a systems architect or similar position
* Translates user experience requirements and business requirements into defined specifications (e.g., Roles and Persona) and inspires the IT team to develop high performing user-friendly systems
* Experience working with various enterprise systems such as HRIS, ERP, CRM, Supply Chain Management, SCADA, Business Intelligence, etc.
* Liaise with Technology Operations as part of the architecture and standards approval process
* Experience supporting software and hardware procurement and/or development and implementation projects
* Proficiency in business intelligence/reporting tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Spotfire, etc.
* Develops and coaches internal project team members to understand methodologies, project requirements, and timelines through clear and consistent communication
* Project management experience is strongly preferred
* Experience working in manufacturing, logistics, or similar industries is strongly preferred

 **Personal Qualifications**

* Excellent business acumen, commitment to teamwork, and results orientation
* Good interpersonal skills and written and verbal communication skills
* Self-confidence, initiative, and strong problem-solving skills
* Impeccable personal and professional ethics
* Experience in blank slate / green field/startup environments where operational infrastructure and services were limited or did not exist is preferred

 **Position Mechanics**

* *Reports to*: Vice President, IT
* *Type*: Salaried, exempt; Full time
* *Work Hours*: Generally, 8:00-5:00, Monday to Friday. There could be occasional evening and weekend work.
* *Staff*: No Direct Report
* *Location*: Houston, TX, or potentially remote
* *Work environment*: Primarily office environment, but may also work in an industrial environment when PPE is required.
* *Travel*: Up to 10% travel as required
* *Physical Demands:* The physical demands of a professional position may require a solid dexterity and constitution to manage the demands of the role. Occasional lifting and walking; must be able to sit for prolonged periods in meetings or travel. Wearing PPE as needed.


Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship for employment visa status.

 **Company Benefits**


Cyclyx offers a competitive benefits package that goes beyond just a paycheck. Our comprehensive benefits package includes competitive company-funded (up to 90% company-paid premiums) health, dental, vision, and insurance plans, robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, and much more. We also provide development and growth opportunities because investing in your success is investing in our success. Also, working for a rapidly growing, fast-paced organization will allow you to grow professionally and expand your network while building a rewarding and dynamic career.

 **Company Culture**

We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining diverse and highly talented individuals. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, an engaging and growing culture, and a variety of opportunities for our employees' professional growth and development.


Cyclyx is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We value mutual respect and diversity in the workplace and are committed to Employment Equity and Inclusion.


We celebrate the unique differences of our employees that drive curiosity, innovation, and the success of our business. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and do not discriminate against any applicant's status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities.

title: Data Architect, Analytics Products (REMOTE)
description:
The Opportunity
Huron helps its clients drive growth, enhance performance and sustain leadership in the markets they serve. We collaborate with education organizations to develop strategies and implement solutions that enable the transformative change our clients need to own their future. Together, we empower clients to drive innovation, create sustainable funding streams and deliver better student outcomes.  

  

Today, leaders of higher education institutions and academic medical centers are spending too much time reacting to market forces, rather than focusing on the essential priorities that help students, faculty and staff thrive. The most productive path forward requires an intentional approach and innovative thinking, whereby stakeholders across the entire institution rally around a shared vision and embrace the hard work of effecting change.  

  

You’ll help our clients to achieve organizational effectiveness, improve student outcomes, implement new technologies and align resources and investments to ensure long-term sustainability.  

  

Join our team as the expert you are now and create your future.
Position Summary
The Data Architect’s overarching role is translating business requirements into technology requirements. You will define data standards and principles which developers will use to implement product features. You must have knowledge of complex data processing and analytics data pipelines and will design pipeline solutions by applying big data strategies and architectures. You must demonstrate an understanding of dimensional data modeling, data integration, data transformation, data cleansing, and data warehousing. The Data Architect must be able to demonstrate innovative approaches to complex problems which deliver industry-leading experiences for business stakeholders. You must also be able to effectively communicate design strategies and approaches to a team of engineers, and ensure the implementation meets overall system requirements. We are looking for those with a strong computer science foundation and the ability to quickly get up to speed with technologies they may not be familiar with. The ability to learn and grow quickly is a must.
Qualifications
Responsibilities/essentials duties include:* Apply dimensional data modeling principles to design a data architecture framework for a large multi-tenant application with intent to address a variety of use cases.
* Collaborate with Global Products Data Architects to visualize and design the framework using Global Products architecture standards. This framework describes the process of planning, specifying, creating, acquiring, maintaining, using, retrieving, archiving, controlling, and purging data.
* Work with the Product Owner and Subject Matter Experts to develop a standard business vocabulary.
* Translate business and strategic requirements into high-level integrated technical designs, including data streams, integrations, transformations, databases, and data lake/warehouses.
* Define the reference architecture patterns that a team of data engineers can follow.
* Create and maintain framework documentation, including design strategy, flow diagrams, and data processes.
* Educate and lead a team of data engineers and visualization specialists to implement the framework according to the high-level technical design.
* Collaborate and coordinate with vendors and stakeholders across departments to comprehensively understand system requirements and develop architecture strategies. Stakeholders include, but are not limited to, Huron IT, the Data Governance Committee, Client Services, Product Management, Engineering, and others.


Required:* U.S. work authorization is required.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Science/Technology-based related discipline or equivalent work experience.
* 8+ years of industry experience as a professional software developer building multi-tier, scalable, enterprise level products.
* Motivated, self-starter with ability to learn quickly, make informed decisions, and provide direction to a team
* Must be a hands-on individual who is comfortable interfacing frequently with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate those needs to technical engineers
* Display sound problem-solving abilities in the face of challenges, with the ability to look at the “big picture” when designing solutions
* Knowledge of and ability to apply dimensional modeling principles to new business processes
* Deep understanding of Data Lake/Lakehouse principles and technologies (Athena/Presto/Hive/Glue Catalog)
* SQL, python skills
* Strong computer science fundamentals


Preferred:* Infrastructure-as-code exposure is a benefit (CloudFormation/Terraform).
* Knowledge of data vault modeling is preferred.
* Familiarity or knowledge of Cloud ecosystems (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
* Familiarity or knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark.
* Experience in designing and implementing innovative data integration solutions, utilizing Python with Spark clusters
* Familiarity with architectural patterns for data-intensive solutions
* Knowledge of batch-style data processing
* Knowledge of the RDBMS core principles; set up, tune, design, as well as newer unstructured data tools
* Ability to learn, provide feedback on, and optimize use of new software as introduced by Global Products Data Architects
* Familiarity with traditional application design
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Benefits to have experience with Agile Methodology and global teamwork
* Possess excellent interpersonal and organizational skills
* Able to manage your own time and work well both independently and as the technical leader of a team

* TECHNOLOGIES WE USE
* Cloud (AWS) / RDBMS (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, DB2) / NoSQL / Python / Big Data (Spark) / Integration Tools (AWS Glue/Lambda // Microsoft PowerShell / AWS SDK / Cube.js / Visualization Tools (AWS QuickSight)


The estimated base salary range for this job is $140,000 - $200,000. The range represents a good faith estimate of the range that Huron reasonably expects to pay for this job at the time of the job posting. The actual salary paid to an individual will vary based on multiple factors, including but not limited to specific skills or certifications, years of experience, market changes, and required travel. This job is also eligible to participate in Huron’s annual incentive compensation program, which reflects Huron’s pay for performance philosophy. Inclusive of annual incentive compensation opportunity, the total estimated compensation range for this job is $161,000 - $250,000. The job is also eligible to participate in Huron’s benefit plans which include medical, dental and vision coverage and other wellness programs. The salary range information provided is in accordance with applicable state and local laws regarding salary transparency that are currently in effect and may be implemented in the future
Posting Category
Education
Opportunity Type
Regular
Country
United States of America

title: Lead ServiceNow Developer (Remote)
description:
\\*We are open to supporting 100% remote work anywhere within the U.S.\\*
The Digital Modernization division of ICF is seeking a motivated Lead ServiceNow Developer. In this role, you will assist the ServiceNow Platform team with governance of the platform, including development of new functionality and integrations, small customization, configuration, troubleshooting errors, remedying incidents, and conducting root-cause analysis. This role is client facing and all team members are expected to champion tasks, interface with customers and have a high level of logistical skill that wouldn’t necessarily be needed on a regular developer role.
Our Digital Modernization division is an information technology and management consulting department that offers integrated, strategic solutions to its public and private-sector clients. ICF has the expertise, agility, and commitment to design, build, and operate high-performance IT engines to support all aspects of our client’s business. Some work may be required to be performed at a client site in Rockville, MD.
As a Senior or Lead ServiceNow Developer you play a pivotal role in successfully leading the design and deployment of ServiceNow solutions for our clients. In this role, you will lead the design, configuration, customization, and implementation of ServiceNow applications to meet specific business requirements. Your technical expertise and leadership, attention to detail, and commitment to excellence will contribute significantly to the success of our projects and the satisfaction of our clients.
What you will be doing:* Implementation Support: Implement enhancements based on priority given by platform owner; conduct code reviews and ensure adherence to best practices. Collaborate with cross-functional teams and implement solutions that align with the designed requirements and ensure solutions meet industry best practices. Develop and maintain advanced scripts, business rules, and client scripts.
* Integration and Automation: Support existing ServiceNow integrations and work with the team on any future integrations that the client needs.
* Enhancement Requests: Design, develop and support the promotion process of individual enhancement requests across the platform.
* Deployment Management: All developers are expected to occasionally support weekly platform deployments from various development teams, a firm grip of update set management and promotion is needed. There is also potential to input on a redesign of the promotion process.
* Incident and Problem Resolution: Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to ServiceNow implementations. Collaborate with support teams to provide timely resolution to incidents and problems. Troubleshoot errors and remedy incidents that are assigned to the Platform Queue inclusive of user access, integrations, scripting, etc. Conduct root cause analysis and provide work arounds for platform issues.
* Performance Optimization: Collaborate with solutions architects to analyze platform performance, design optimization strategies, and implement performance and security improvement configurations, contributing to the overall stability, efficiency, and security of ServiceNow solutions.
* Quality Assurance: Conduct thorough testing of ServiceNow configurations to validate functionality, data integrity, and user experience. Address any issues and perform necessary adjustments to ensure the solution meets the desired outcomes.
* Road Mapping: Support Platform Architects in designing and planning for major road mapping items, including upgrades, clone downs and major initiatives.
* Citizen Development Support: Partner with Citizen developers to automate business tools at an accelerated pace. This would be to help with AEMC governance, handovers between citizen development and pro-development and promotion to production.
* Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with project managers, other implementation specialists, and stakeholders to ensure seamless project coordination and effective, regular communication, including risks, issues, successes, and overall project status.
* Continuous Learning: Stay updated on ServiceNow advancements and industry trends in order to advise client of new features and functionality.
* Client Relationships: Understand client needs, provide guidance, and exceed expectations.


What you must have:* Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution
* 7+ years’ experience implementing ServiceNow solutions.
* ServiceNow Certified Application Developer Certification.
* US Citizenship or green card is required due to federal contract requirements.
* Must be able to obtain Public Trust clearance.


Desired Skills:* Any Certified Implementation Specialist certification.
* ServiceNow Certified System Administrator certification
* In-depth knowledge of ServiceNow platform capabilities, modules, and best practices
* Familiarity with ITIL processes and IT Service Management (ITSM) principles
* In-depth knowledge of scripting languages, including JavaScript and GlideScript
* Technical skills, including workflow configuration, and business rule development.
* Problem-solving skills and ability to innovate solutions.
* Detail-oriented tendencies with excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
* The ability to work effectively in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
* Understanding of performance optimization techniques
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to work well under constantly changing deadlines and priorities.

ICF is a global advisory and technology services provider, but we’re not your typical consultants. We combine unmatched expertise with cutting-edge technology to help clients solve their most complex challenges, navigate change, and shape the future.
We can only solve the world's toughest challenges by building an inclusive workplace that allows everyone to thrive.
