title: Principal Earned Value Specialist (Remote & Hybrid Eligible)
description:
Provide Earned Value Management implementation support to ensure compliance with all government requirements and internal procedures. As a Principal EVM Specialist, you will develop internal processes and procedures, standardized formats, and conduct EVM training for all project stakeholders. By providing EVM oversight and training, program management will take ownership of program performance data. You will lead data analytics/program reviews and advise leadership on areas to improve business performance. You will also support the Program Finance leaders in fulfilling their responsibilities to ongoing cross-department continuous improvement, problem solving, project implementation, training, and governance efforts.
The ISR (Intelligence, Surveillance & Reconnaissance), Aviation, and Security (IAS) business area is a leader in ISR and aviation, it is a leading prime manned and unmanned aircraft systems integrator for innovative, high-performance ISR and aviation systems. Its end-to-end Command, Control, Computers, Communications and Intelligence, Surveillance & Reconnaissance (C4ISR) capabilities encompass design, integration, test, certification, ground/flight training and complete logistics support. IAS tailors solutions to customer cost, performance, and schedule requirements and designs to consistently exceed expectations – with an unrivaled record of on time and on (or under) budget deliveries. Learn more about IAS

**Must Haves:**

* A Bachelor's degree in business, or a related field and 20 years or more of related work experience.
* Higher education may substitute for relevant experience
* Relevant experience may be considered in lieu of required education
* Ability to support tool evaluations, process integrations, and testing of system changes
* Engage and build trust with the program management office to understand EVM benefits
* Provide PMO with skills and tools necessary to be successful
* Ability to develop and recommend cost and schedule management solutions relative to contract requirements
* A proven background and competency in Earned Value Management
* Ability to develop effective EVM procedures to include scalable, training, and work instructions relative to regulatory standards and internal processes
* Apply Earned Value Management concepts in working with federal government contracts, budget process, and fund management
* Capability to perform in depth earned value data analysis, inclusive of data quality checks and CDRL/SDRL (IPMDAR, CFSR, CSDR, etc.) review.
* Advanced skills in Earned Value Management software (Deltek Cobra), and familiarity with scheduling, and analytics software methodologies.
* Advanced experience implementing, training, and creating standard reports in Encore Analytics Empower

**Preferred:**

* Ability to work across multiple software systems and comprehend system relationships
* Develop and conduct relevant stakeholder learning sessions
* Experience in Earned Value validation or re-validation
* Experience in successful completion of Program IBRs, JSRs and Internal Surveillances (to include completion of actions items), inclusive of training or coaching Control Account Managers and program teams
* Foundational understanding of Program Management processes


At Sierra Nevada Corporation (SNC) we deliver customer-focused technology and best-of-breed integrations in the aerospace and defense sectors. SNC has been honored as one of the most innovative U.S. companies in space, a Tier One Superior Supplier for the U.S. Air Force, and as one of America’s fastest-growing companies. Learn more about SNC


SNC offers annual incentive pay based upon performance that is commensurate with the level of the position.


SNC offers a generous benefit package, including medical, dental, and vision plans, 401(k) with 150% match up to 6%, life insurance, 3 weeks paid time off, tuition reimbursement, and more.

**IMPORTANT NOTICE:**


This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a Secret U.S. Security Clearance. U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position needs an active U.S. Security Clearance for employment. Non-U.S. citizens may not be eligible to obtain a security clearance. The Department of Defense Consolidated Adjudications Facility (DoD CAF), a federal government agency, handles the adjudicative aspects of the security clearance eligibility process for industry applicants. Adjudicative factors which affect the outcome of the eligibility determination include, but are not limited to, allegiance to the U.S., foreign influence, foreign preference, criminal conduct, security violations and illegal drug use.
Learn more about the background check process for Security Clearances.


At Sierra Nevada Corporation (SNC), our mission is to dream, innovate, inspire and empower the next generation to transform humanity through technology and imagination. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we welcome our employees to bring their whole selves to their work. SNC is committed to fostering an inclusive, accepting, and diverse environment free of discrimination. Employment decisions are made without regarding to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or other characteristics protected by law. Contributions to SNC come in many shapes and styles, and we believe diversity in our workforce fosters new and greater ways to dream, innovate, and inspire.

title: Director, Logistics and Warehousing, North America
description:
Date Posted:
2024-01-24
Country:
United States of America
Location:
OTCTH: Connecticut Home Offices Remote Location, Remote City, CT, 06032 USA
Role Overview:
This role will be responsible for executing the global logistics strategy within North America across new equipment, modernization, and spare parts businesses. It will interface with operations, real estate, finance, planning, supply chain and field personnel. The individual will lead both existing and new transformational projects/implementations across both logistics and warehousing in the region.
Essential Responsibilities:* Provide leadership for the North American logistics category with spend ~ $85M, including transportation and distribution / warehousing. Understand variations in the supplier and category landscape across Otis. Define and monitor applicable KPIs to track the health of the logistics ecosystem. Stay current on industry topics and emerging trends, through participation in industry organizations to understand best practices.
* Design regional transportation strategies to optimize total cost, capacity, quality, visibility, sustainability, safety and compliance across all modes, end to end; Identify centrally led versus field led strategies. Drive alignment to the global strategy across aspect of the logistics and warehousing operations in North America.
* Execute distribution and warehousing strategies for new equipment, modernization, and spare parts regionally to optimize total cost, capacity, visibility, quality, sustainability, safety, and compliance.
* Develop logistics savings and performance targets across transportation and distribution sub-categories regionally/locally.
* Conduct RFQs and lead negotiations and master services agreement developments. Conduct regular business reviews and establish continuous improvement and mitigation plans for all key logistics and warehouse partners.
* Provide robust category reporting / business intelligence cadence for use by local and global logistics team, senior management, regional & local supply chain management, sales/marketing, finance, and major project teams. Proactively advise the organization on emerging issues.


Requirements:* BA/BS degree in supply chain, logistics, engineering, or business with 10+ years’ experience, master’s degree with 7+ year of experience
* Travel: Up to 25% including international
* Demonstrated experience managing logistics spend category, including executing transformational strategies, developing processes, managing suppliers, and driving compliance, savings, and process efficiency in a North America environment.
* Demonstrated strong understanding of pricing models, KPIs and contracts across all modes (LTL, FTL, Fleet, IML, Ocean, Air and parcel).
* Proven ability to lead cross functionally, understanding cross functional business requirements as well as motivating in a matrixed organization.
* Strong experience working / managing 3PLs and 4PLs including bidding, negotiation, and contract development with favorable terms and SLAs.
* Proven ability to apply independent business judgment and demonstrate influence to drive strategy and achieve results.
* Excellent analytical skills, ability to lead data analysis and resolution of complex problems where success requires the evaluation of both tangible and intangible variables.
* Ability to communicate with multifunctional stakeholders including supply chain managers, leadership, and suppliers, and excellent listening and influencing skills
* Understanding of SIOP processes.
* Experience with global quality systems like Six Sigma and Lean, certification a plus
* Experience with change management, such as ADKAR, certification a plus
* Strong project management experience, certification a plus
* High energy and dynamic, with strong interpersonal skills
*Apply today to join us and build* *what’s* *next!*  

If you live in a city, chances are we will give you a lift or play a role in keeping you moving every day.
Otis is the world’s leading elevator and escalator manufacturing, installation, and service company. We move 2 billion people every day and maintain approximately 2.2 million customer units worldwide, the industry's largest Service portfolio.
You may recognize our products in some of the world’s most famous landmarks including the Eiffel Tower, Empire State Building, Burj Khalifa and the Petronas Twin Towers! We are 69,000 people strong, including engineers, digital technology experts, sales, and functional specialists, as well as factory and field technicians, all committed to meeting the diverse needs of our customers and passengers in more than 200 countries and territories worldwide. We are proud to be a diverse, global team with a proven legacy of innovation that continues to be the bedrock of a fast-moving, high-performance company.
When you join Otis, you become part of an innovative global industry leader with a resilient business model. You’ll belong to a diverse, trusted, and caring community where your contributions, and the skills and capabilities you’ll gain working alongside the best and brightest, keep us connected and on the cutting edge.
We provide opportunities, training, and resources, that build leadership and capabilities in Sales, Field, Engineering and Major Projects and our Employee Scholar Program is a notable point of pride, through which Otis sponsors colleagues to pursue degrees or certification programs.
Today, our focus more than ever is on people. As a global, people-powered company, we put people – passengers, customers, and colleagues – at the center of everything we do. We are guided by our values that we call our Three Absolutes – prioritizing Safety, Ethics, Quality in all that we do. If you would like to learn more about environmental, social and governance (ESG) at Otis click here.
Become a part of the Otis team and help us #Buildwhatsnext!*Otis is An Equal* *Opportunity/Affirmative* *Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.* *To request an accommodation in completing an employment application due to a special need or a disability, please contact us at* *careers@otis.com**.*

title: Decarbonization Program Specialist
description:
Overview:

Knauf Insulation North America is the world's fastest-growing insulation manufacturer. We are wholly committed to the conservation of the environment while also sustainably developing and manufacturing a comprehensive line of acoustical fiberglass insulation for residential, commercial, industrial, marine, OEM and metal building applications, using post-consumer recycled materials.  

We welcome passionate and creative individuals who thrive in an entrepreneurial, collaborative and ever-changing environment. **We know how important your health, wellbeing, and financial strength is to you. To support you, we provide affordable benefits for you and your family members.** ***"Supporting all aspects of the individual — self, health, wealth and community”*** **Our benefits include:**  

* Medical, Dental, Vision – starting on day one!
* Virtual Medical Services
* 401(k) Retirement Plan (earn 100% matching on your first 6% and fully vested day one)
* Paid parental leave
* Company paid life insurance
* Vacation time to enjoy getting away
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Plus, more!


Growth opportunities available! **Apply online or contact us to hear why our employees appreciate being part of the Knauf family!** **Summary of Position**:  

As a Specialist, you will develop, implement, manage, and lead the decarbonization strategy/program, help the company achieve our Carbon emissions goals. As a critical component of the strategy, you will be identify and manage funding and partnerships opportunities to leverage the strategy implementation.
Responsibilities:
* Develop strategy to reduce the organization's carbon footprint (strategic & business planning, implementation, management and reporting)
* Serve as a subject matter expert on carbon emissions (scope 1, 2, and 3), green energy and emerging technologies in the US market, i.e. performing technical & financial analysis, market, policy, cost-effective green technologies that eliminate GHG emissions, electrification
* Identify external funding opportunities and lead grant and tax application efforts: write proposals, prepare budget, lead and manage such projects to decarbonize our operations (i.e manufacturing, supply chain, logistics)
* Lead and manage carbon emissions technical roadmap, reviewing strategy, proposing targets/KPIs by location, facilitating the exchange between sustainability, engineering team, sustainability engineers, plant managers and continuous improvement teams, and establishing reporting governance
* Be KINA’s representative on Knauf’s carbon emissions global technical forums and working groups as a matter expert, and prepare communication materials on decarbonization strategy/initiatives to senior leadership functions and drive integration and accountability in other functions throughout the organization
* Lead the refinement of the company’s carbon footprint data collection and reporting by developing, improving, and optimizing process for data collection and template reports on carbon emissions, addressing gaps in current procedures to guarantee compliance with external reporting structures and requirements
* Provide leadership, guidance, and support to business unit leading discussions cross-functionally with departments, developing scalable and repeatable processes to assess, plan and guide business units on the development of business unit-level net zero plans (with focus on scope 3)
* Lead study case for carbon handprint (scope 4), establishing and managing partnership with reputable institutions, manage contract and payments, serving as liaison between external partner and internal teams, defining scope and manage the project
* Develop internal policies and internal guidebook to address carbon emissions reductions


Qualifications:

Education:
* Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in environmental science, sustainability, engineering, finance or equivalent experience
* Project Management degree or relevant related experience


Experience:* 5 years managing high complexity projects
* 5 years of relevant sustainability and topic related experience
* Subject matter knowledge of GHG Protocol, Paris Agreement, and legal and regulatory framework surrounding climate change is highly regarded but not essential.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:* This is a position that requires experience in developing strategies, business plans, project management, writing projects to grants/funding opportunities, technical background with the ability to communicate and coordinate across different departments
* Excellence in development and delivery of presentations for executive audiences, with ability to distill and effectively communicate highly complex information to leaders
* At least 5 years’ experience managing projects, preferably with decarbonization goals
* Experience working with facilities, procurement, supply chain, and logistics sustainability efforts.
* Microsoft Excel expert
* Ability to manage large data sets from multiple sources and perform data analysis to meet business requirements

  

(Preferred Skills)* Masters degree in Business, Sustainability, Environmental Science or Environmental Engineering is a plus
* Knowledge of green building standards (e.g., LEED, WELL and LBC),
* Familiarity with SAP, Sharepoint, Teams, Outlook and other systems
* Knowledge/network: Better Buildings Alliance, Grid-interactive Efficient Buildings, Energy Star, Advanced Building Construction, Net Zero Energy Ready Homes, Building America, Building codes, etc.

  

It is the policy of Knauf Insulation to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected characteristic prohibited by applicable law.

title: Waste & Circular Economy Specialist
description:
Overview:

Knauf Insulation North America is the world's fastest-growing insulation manufacturer. We are wholly committed to the conservation of the environment while also sustainably developing and manufacturing a comprehensive line of acoustical fiberglass insulation for residential, commercial, industrial, marine, OEM and metal building applications, using post-consumer recycled materials.  

We welcome passionate and creative individuals who thrive in an entrepreneurial, collaborative and ever-changing environment. **We know how important your health, wellbeing, and financial strength is to you. To support you, we provide affordable benefits for you and your family members.** ***"Supporting all aspects of the individual — self, health, wealth and community”*** **Our benefits include:**  

* Medical, Dental, Vision – starting on day one!
* Virtual Medical Services
* 401(k) Retirement Plan (earn 100% matching on your first 6% and fully vested day one)
* Paid parental leave
* Company paid life insurance
* Vacation time to enjoy getting away
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Plus, more!


Growth opportunities available! **Apply online or contact us to hear why our employees appreciate being part of the Knauf family!** **Summary of Position**:  

As a specialist, you will develop, implement, manage and lead the waste and circular economy program, help Knauf Insulation North America to achieve its goals (zero waste to landfill and be a leader in circular economy). This role entails the development and implementation of strategies for post-industrial and post-consumer waste, applying principles of circularity, cradle-to-cradle and lifecycle thinking across the company’s diverse business departments, from product development, manufacturing, supply chain to operations, adding value to the different waste streams, transforming environmental challenges into business opportunities.
Responsibilities:
* Develop, implement and manage program strategy to eliminate and/or reduce waste generation, by identifying market trends, new technologies, business models, processes, etc. and proposing deployment of opportunities to recover post-industrial and post-consumer wastes on a commercial scale to be reused, recycled or repurposed
* Revamp office recycling program by proposing strategy across 6 locations where we operate, partnering with plants, marketing and HR teams (in the future to include primary workforce)
* Lead and manage waste technical roadmap, reviewing strategy, proposing targets/KPIs by location, facilitating the exchange between sustainability and plants and establishing a reporting governance (including Global requirements – EFRAG)
* Provide leadership, influence, guidance, and support plants to develop scalable and repeatable processes to segregate waste-streams, accounting, and reporting systems, in partnership with sustainability engineer
* In partnership with plant team, improve post industrial waste inventory (phase 2) to assess, plan and develop plant level data collection and assist to develop zero waste to landfill strategy
* Develop internal policies and internal guidebook to address education, procedures to avoid waste generation and materials recovery (reuse, repurpose, recycle)
* Serve as a subject matter expert, representing KINA in waste and circular economy in Knauf’s global technical working groups
* Lead phase 2 of bioremediation project with external partner to develop next steps, strategy, business plan of non-commodity waste, including IP path and negotiation
* Lead Phase 2 of post-consumer waste project, proposing next steps and strategy for extended responsibility program (i.e take back programs)
* Identify and lead partnerships (i.e Ellen MacArthur Foundation) and/or funding opportunities for circularity: write proposals, prepare budget, lead and manage such projects to recover materials and deploy circular solutions
* Prepare communication materials (internal and external) on waste and circularity strategy/initiatives to address market expectations, as well as to aid senior leadership functions to drive integration and accountability in other functions throughout the organization
* Establish partnership with top clients to develop initiatives to reduce waste generation and recover materials to address clients’ expectations
* Build network and represent Knauf at external stakeholder events and initiatives i.e government or industry association advisory bodies that are shaping the transition to the Circularity to build strategic partnerships.


Qualifications:
**Education**:
* Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in environmental science, sustainability, engineering, or equivalent experience in waste management and circular economy;
* True Zero or similar Certification is a plus
* Project Management (PMO) degree is a plus

 **Experience**:* 5+ years of experience in waste management or circular economy area such as strategy, waste reduction, reuse, recycling, or relevant sustainability and topic related experience.
* 5+ years in project or program management is preferrable
* Strong business acumen, influence, and change management expertise.
* Knowledge on life cycle analysis, circular economy, cradle to cradle and zero waste to landfill certification programs.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:*** Experience in developing strategies, business plans, project management, technical background with the ability to communicate and coordinate across different departments;
* Systems thinking, understanding the interconnectedness of material topics, i.e, impact of waste/circular projects in carbon emissions, as well as how external systems impact the project (i.e regulations, market push, etc.);
* Microsoft Excel advanced;
* Ability to manage large data sets from multiple sources and perform data analysis to meet business requirements;

  

(Preferred Skills)  

* Post-graduate degree in Circular Economy, Sustainability, Sustainable business, Environmental Science
* True Zero or similar Certification, and or knowledge is a plus
* Knowledge on cradle to cradle certification
* Familiarity with SAP, Sharepoint, Teams, Outlook and other systems

  

It is the policy of Knauf Insulation to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected characteristic prohibited by applicable law.

title: Regional Technical Support Specialist, Collision Repair
description:
About Rivian:

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.
Role Summary:

As a Regional Technical Support Specialist, Collision Repair, you will support Rivian’s Certified Network repair strategy reporting directly to the Regional Collision Manager and supporting RCCN Account Managers. You will be responsible for ensuring great customer satisfaction at our Certified Network locations. This role will require the establishment of exacting standards of performance and operational excellence, as well as support of regional on-ground operations. The Regional Technical Support Specialist, will work in the field with 3rd Party Certified Partners, and travel throughout the region.  

This role will require exceptional cross functional interaction across multiple teams within Rivian as well as external 3rd party partners. A dynamic and resourceful team member with proven leadership qualities, great communications skills, an analytical approach to problem solving, continuous improvement, and organization. Responsible for the day-to-day operations in an OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) managed network of high performing 3rd party repair partners in a dynamic environment. This role will require extensive travel, operational excellence, organization and excel in internal and external communication skills – you will bridge the gap between the Rivian Certified Networks, the local Rivian Service Center, the Certified Network Operations Team, and Rivian vehicle owners. The Regional Technical Support Specialist, Collision Repair will report to the Sr. Manager, Certified Collision Network.
Responsibilities:
* Recruit, Onboard, and support 3rd party certified network programs with technical or operational needs
* Execute on deliverables, milestone reports, open action items, risks, and mitigation plans
* Drive quality, continuous improvement, and deliver on key performance indicators
* Collaborate alongside regional management to handle any challenges that arise during repairs of Rivian customer vehicles
* Ensure operational excellence and validate that brand standards are maintained in accordance with Rivian Certified Network Standards
* Drive success for the greater Certified Network by providing feedback to the Network Operations Team
* Collaborate with Network and Service Engineering Teams to address repair challenges and customer concerns
* Analyze the business, create, and communicate clear action plans that optimize results in collaboration with the Regional Manager


Qualifications:
* 5+ years of experience in automotive collision repair, OEM, and/or technical field, with emphasis in engineering, quality, service, operations, and supply chain
* Experience in supporting teams in an automotive or high-tech environment
* Must possess a valid driver’s license, with a clean driving record
* Experience managing multiple projects across varying geographic locations simultaneously
* The ability to effectively communicate with internal and external partners
* Thorough organization and attention to detail
* Ability to sit or stand for 8-10 hours per day
* Ability to lift 35 lbs.
* Occasionally required to climb, walk, stoop, kneel, or crouch
* Requires travel up to 75% of the time


Pay Disclosure:
**Salary Range for California Based Applicants**: $121,000 to $150,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). **Salary Range for Colorado Based Applicants**: $114,000 to $132,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). **Salary Range for New York Based Applicants**: $130,000 to $150,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). **Salary Range for Washington State Based Applicants**: $121,000 to $139,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law). **Benefits Summary:** Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums.
Company Statements:
#### **Equal Opportunity**


Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.#### **Candidate Data Privacy**


Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  

Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions. **Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.**

title: Sr. External 3P Aftersales Support Specialist -Central or West Coast
description:
About Rivian:

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.
Role Summary:

Responsible for helping support Rivian’s Service and Collision Team’s day to day needs by providing after sales support to independent 3P service and collision centers. This role will require strong initiative, independent judgement, an ability to problem solve, and cross-team collaboration. The Sr. External 3P Aftersales Support Specialist will report the Rivian's Manager, Internal Collision Systems & Operations.


Responsibilities:
* Support the execution of parts and technical support for external 3P certified collision, non-certified collision, and independent service providers
* Ensure external 3P service and collision center customers receive industry leading customer support
* Support our external 3P service and collision center customers digitally with any technical or operational questions
* Identify training needs or process improvement through the interactions with the external 3P service and collision centers
* Ensure that processes are developed, assessed, communicated, and administered in compliance with Rivian’s objectives
* Assist with the operations and the success of supporting the needs of the external 3P service, certified, and non-certified collision centers
* Collaborate cross-functionally with the Service Engineering & Operations Organizations to obtain the info or direction you need to pass down to the inquiring business
* Create, track, and manage support tickets on any inquires you work on for all inquires
* Engage with external 3P service and collision centers regarding program performance and repair quality standards
* Must be able to complete support tickets and inquiries in a compressed timeline


Qualifications:
* Collision Repair and Mechanical Repair Degree preferred or equivalent experience
* 3 + year's Service or Collision experience
* Knowledge in Electric Vehicle estimation is a plus
* Ability to view, read, and interpret automotive repair procedures and accurately identify parts in a parts catalogue
* Experience writing service for an OEM or Dealerships is a plus
* Understanding of collision repair practices and processes used in collision repair
* OEM specific, collision and mechanical training is a plus
* Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet project deadlines
* Ability to work independently, accurately, and effectively in performing task or duties as assigned to completion
* Professional demeanor, strong communication, writing and presentation skills
* Knowledge in Salesforce, Smartsheets, and Lucid Charts is a plus
* High proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, SharePoint, and Outlook
* Capable of working efficiently in a start-up environment
* Willingness to work in a strong cross functional environment
* Ability to manage multiple projects across varying geographic locations simultaneously
* Geographically living in CST, MST, or PST timezone working from 8am to 5pm PST hours
* Ability to travel 25%
* Must possess a valid driver’s license
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be regularly required to stand, sit, talk, hear, reach, stoop, kneel, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer, telephone, and keyboard for an extended period of time
* Ability to read and utilize computers
* Ability to sit or stand for 8 to 10 hours per day
* Ability to lift about 25 lbs. independently


Pay Disclosure:
**Salary Range for California Based Applicants**: $85,000 to $108,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law).

 **Salary Range for Colorado Based Applicants**: $81,000 to $94,000 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law).

 **Benefits Summary:** Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums.

If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.#### **Candidate Data Privacy**


Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  

Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions. **Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.**

title: AD & Entra Specialist
description:
### **Job Description**

**Job Description:**

**Position Overview:**We are seeking a skilled AD & Entra Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Entra (formerly Azure Active Directory) environments, both on-premises and in the cloud, and possess expertise in managing and maintaining Entra services. This role will be responsible for ensuring the security, performance, and seamless operation of directory services while collaborating with other IT teams to align with the organization's overall IT strategy.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Define and execute daily management, maintenance, and support activities for the Entra environment, ensuring minimal disruption to the network.
* Plan and implement upgrades to the Entra system, including the installation, configuration, and upgrade of the Public Key Infrastructure for secure communications and transactions.
* Administer, manage, and maintain Entra services to ensure optimal performance and security.
* Implement and manage Entra AD Connect for synchronization between on-premises directories and Entra.
* Lead and execute migration projects, ensuring a seamless transition of directory services to Entra.
* Oversee and administer Mobile Device Management solutions integrated with Entra to enhance the security and management of mobile devices.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience.
* 3+ years of proven experience in managing Entra (formerly Azure AD) environments.
* Experience in other areas of Azure, M365, or On-Premises Solutions will be considered a bonus.
* Relevant Microsoft certifications related to Entra (formerly Azure AD) are a plus.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* A proactive and collaborative approach to team collaboration.
* Knowledge of security, policy, and compliance in directory services.
* Understanding of governance and controls in relation to Entra (formerly Azure AD).


If you are a skilled technical expert with a passion for managing directory services environments and ensuring their security and performance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and contribute to our organization's success in providing top-notch IT solutions.

### **About Bravo Consulting Group**

**Bravo Consulting Group**is a people first company!

title: Data Governance Specialist - Federal
description:
**Data Governance Specialist**

**Fully remote or Hybrid, seeking candidates based in DMV Area Locations - Richmond, Charlottesville, Virginia Beach, Baltimore, etc.**

**The Company:**


Censeo Consulting Group is a top Washington D.C. based management consulting firm dedicated to helping public sector and non-profit clients build operational excellence, deliver better outcomes, and lower cost. We take a personalized approach to strategic consulting to solve our clients’ most complex problems and build operational excellence that transforms their organizations, allowing them to better deliver on their public and social missions.


At Censeo, our award-winning culture means you’ll join a tight-knit community of 75 brilliant and passionate colleagues. We are advocates for a better functioning public sector, and we’re also good friends who know the names of each other’s dogs. Our philosophy is horizontal, not hierarchical, and our open-door policy encourages a culture of entrepreneurship at all levels. We share successes, make decisions together, and foster an environment for those with initiative to lead. Our colleagues bring their own unique personalities to work every day and use them to help shape our growing firm in ways that reach far beyond client projects.

**The Position:**


We are seeking a Data Governance Specialist to support a federal client in managing data governance implementation for the CFO's office. Some examples of responsibilities include:

* Develop in-depth knowledge of client issues, needs, and contexts related to data governance including: implementing data standards, data policy, data security, and data processing procedures in alignment with the Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA)
* Share insights, results, and recommendations in a comprehensible manner through both written presentations/reports and interactions with teams/clients to drive best practices and process improvement in organization-wide data governance
* Evaluate data management tools, templates, and other enablement, and makes recommendations about their selection
* Support integration efforts with cloud services/storage, on-premise data centers, and other software and infrastructure for the client
* Support the development and maintenance of an enterprise data model, including a data taxonomy that aligns with the statutory and strategic frameworks aligned with client needs
* Work with client stakeholders and working groups to develop process maps, project plans, and identify opportunities for efficiencies and improvement
* Lead discrete deliverables and / or workstreams related to data governance management
* Develop program collateral in the Google Suite, including Google Docs, Google Slides, and Google Sheets
* Proactively identify program risks, and deploy mitigation strategies

**The Ideal Candidate:**


At Censeo, we are looking for unique candidates whose passion and enthusiasm will help shape Censeo’s client insights and workplace culture. Our staff have a wide range of backgrounds, areas of expertise, personality types, and favorite breakfast foods. Our client and cultural successes are rooted in our team’s innovation, creative problem solving, and collaboration. The unique perspective that you bring and the way you tackle problems are much more important to us than what’s printed on your diploma. We believe a successful Data Governance Specialist will have:

* BA / BS Degree
* Consulting experience supporting data management and data governance including expert knowledge of implementing data standards, data policy, data security, and data processing procedures in alignment with the Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA).
	+ **Junior Level:** 0-3 years
	+ **Mid Level:** 4-7 years
	+ **Senior Level:** 7-10 years
* Experience within the General Services Administration (GSA) highly valued
* Ability to obtain a public trust security clearance
* Excellent customer service skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and strong analytic skills.
* Experience creating, analyzing, and presenting surveys and data analysis
* Experience with Microsoft Office and Google Suite
* Ability to build a strong degree of trust with the client
* Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail related to project management and task/deadline tracking

**The Location****:**


Censeo Consulting Group is based in Washington D.C. and open to hybrid and remote job seekers

**The Fine Print****:**

* Expected travel 0-10%; may increase based on business needs
* This is an exempt, full-time position
* Essential Physical Functions
	+ Sitting: Particularly for sustained periods of time
	+ Light Carrying: Physically transporting items weighing less than 15 pounds from one location to another


Censeo offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, including paid vacation and sick leave, flexible and remote work opportunities, and tuition and training reimbursement. More information on our benefits and perks can be found at: https://www.censeoconsulting.com/about/join-us/.


Censeo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all applicants and employees in full compliance with all applicable state and federal laws prohibiting discrimination on the basis of race, color, age, gender, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other class protected by applicable state or federal law.

**Join Our Award-Winning Culture!**


Our passion wins awards. But don’t just take it from us…

* 2023 Vault #9 Best Consulting Firm for Work/Life Balance
* 2023 Vault #23 Best Consulting Firm for Overall Diversity
* 2023 Management Consulted #3 Best Boutique Firms in Washington DC
* 2022 Vault #41 Best Overall Consulting Firm to Work For
* 2020 Vault #21 Best Boutique Consulting Firm
* 2019 Ivy Exec #7 Best Boutique Consulting Firm
* 2018 Consulting Magazine Best Small Firms to Work For
* 2017 Vault #12 Best Boutique Consulting Firm
* 2016 Forbes Best Management Consulting Firms in America
* 2015 Washington Business Journal’s Philanthropy List

title: Cloud Presales
description:
### **Job Information**


Work Experience


**9-12 years**Industry


**IT Services**City


**Dallas**State/Province


**Texas**Country


**United States**Zip/Postal Code


**75201**### **Job Description**


**Cloud Presales**

 **Preferred Experience: 10+ Years**

 **Job Location: Remote – Anywhere in the US**

  

* As a key member of the solution architecture team, ensure success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform
* Partner with the sales team, formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives through the adoption of AWS
* Educate customers of all sizes on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud
* Planning and preparation of business proposals, RFP/RFI/RFQ responses end-to-end.
* Conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers considering or already using AWS
* Capture and share best-practice knowledge within the AWS solutions architect community
* Author or otherwise contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as white papers
* Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates
* Act as a technical liaison between customers, service engineering teams and support
* Work alongside with strategic account sales representatives in closing business by providing business and technology expertise during the sales cycle for cloud-based AWS applications.
* Responsible for discovery calls, solution architecture definition, and delivery of solution-based demonstrations to enterprise clients. Provide direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/ application to client business.
* Meeting with clients to discuss their solution needs.
* Present and articulate advanced AWS features and benefits, product future direction and overall solutions.
* The support sales team in online/in-person selling efforts with minimal supervision.
* Strategizing with the sales team to create customized solutions.
* Drafting and delivering presentations on targeted technologies.

### **Requirements**

* Deep hands-on experience leading the design, implementation or consulting experience with AWS cloud application.
* Hands on experience in presales and working with enterprise customers
* Subject matter level expertise on AWS Network & Security, AWS Compute (EC2) & Storage, Backup & DR, Monitoring, AWS Governance & Cost Management, migration, DevOps.
* Rich experience in Migration projects and good knowledge of migration tools (native and third party) like CloudEndure, MGN
* Infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting (E.g., Terraform, Cloud Formation etc)
* Configuration management using Ansible and/or Chef/Puppet, Shell, PowerShell.
* Implementing experience with primary AWS services (EC2, ELB, ECS, RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, Route53 & S3)
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.

 **Preferred Qualifications**

  

* One or more cloud certifications, preferably in AWS.
* Experience designing/developing solutions built on Cloud
* Demonstrated thought leadership through publications and public speaking.

title: Director, R&D Business Systems Lead
description:
Join a Legacy of Innovation 110 Years and Counting!  

  

Daiichi Sankyo Group is dedicated to the creation and supply of innovative pharmaceutical therapies to improve standards of care and address diversified, unmet medical needs of people globally by leveraging our world-class science and technology. With more than 100 years of scientific expertise and a presence in more than 20 countries, Daiichi Sankyo and its 16,000 employees around the world draw upon a rich legacy of innovation and a robust pipeline of promising new medicines to help people. Under the Group’s 2025 Vision to become a “Global Pharma Innovator with Competitive Advantage in Oncology,” Daiichi Sankyo is primarily focused on providing novel therapies in oncology, as well as other research areas centered around rare diseases and immune disorders.
Job Summary
The Business Systems Lead is responsible for providing or managing the operational, administrative, and tactical support of 1 or more business systems typically in a single function, along with inputting into the broader systems strategy and landscape. This roles focus is on Business process capabilities on a global enterprise operating model that serves as a lead or contributor on projects and initiatives that optimize the use of information technology to achieve R&D and enterprise business objectives.
The Business Systems Lead will function as a manager of one or more business systems (Planisware Safety Vigilance, Data Lakes) from a business process perspective, as a leader of sub-teams or workstreams within larger projects or programs, enhancements or changes, as a lead/contributor within various systems-related working groups, and as an experienced business analyst, as required. This role regularly collaborates with leadership, business process owners, R&D Excellence team members, and information technology leads and specialists.
The Business Systems Lead works under the direction of the Global Business Systems Owner in supporting one or more Line Functions as a part of the Global Development Information Mgmt, Systems Management group. This role will have direct line management of GDIM business system analysts and project managers along with indirect management of business process engineers, trainers, organizational change managers and data analysts supporting systems projects within G-DIM.
Systems Administration & Operational Support
Lead the day-to-day management of the administrative and operational support of assigned systems
Monitor, assess, and improve the administrative and operational support processes – including, but not limited, to user access, user experience, user adoption, procedural documents, user training, and issue resolution
Identify, evaluate, govern, and prioritize proposed changes to assigned systems anchored to a roadmap, to address the evolving requirements of the user community and to support imperatives identified by Line Function leadership
Ensure data within assigned systems is maintained to the highest levels of quality and defined standards, and propose improvements to address gaps or sustainability concerns
Manage user access and monitor/manage ticket resolution/escalation
Perform periodic voice-of-customer exercises for assigned systems to identify any necessary maintenance, expansion, or user experience improvements
Define and monitor key metrics of risk and performance for assigned systems
In collaboration with IT partners, determine the necessary Business/IT resource, budget and Steering Committee required on future IT projects
Determine and track KPIs related to system utilization, stability, and data quality against defined targets for assigned systems
Initiate periodic critical reviews of the overall effectiveness of assigned system, which includes taking any necessary corrective or preventive action to ensure continued success
In collaboration with IT, maintain effective relationships with solution vendors to ensure R&D short and long-term objectives are met within each platform, with an eye towards continuous improvement
Project Execution
Lead all business-led project deliverables including – but, not limited to – process engineering or reengineering, user requirements definition, test scenario & test case development, user training, acceptance testing, and business support & administration
Ensure that all large and small projects have a formal problem/opportunity statement, business case, return on investment and Systems Administration & Operational Support
Lead the day-to-day management of the administrative and operational support of assigned systems
Monitor, assess, and improve the administrative and operational support processes – including, but not limited, to user access, user experience, user adoption, procedural documents, user training, and issue resolution
Identify, evaluate, govern, and prioritize proposed changes to assigned systems anchored to a roadmap, to address the evolving requirements of the user community and to support imperatives identified by Line Function leadership
Ensure data within assigned systems is maintained to the highest levels of quality and defined standards, and propose improvements to address gaps or sustainability concerns
Manage user access and monitor/manage ticket resolution/escalation
Perform periodic voice-of-customer exercises for assigned systems to identify any necessary maintenance, expansion, or user experience improvements
Define and monitor key metrics of risk and performance for assigned systems
In collaboration with IT partners, determine the necessary Business/IT resource, budget and Steering Committee required on future IT projects
Determine and track KPIs related to system utilization, stability, and data quality against defined targets for assigned systems
Initiate periodic critical reviews of the overall effectiveness of assigned system, which includes taking any necessary corrective or preventive action to ensure continued success
In collaboration with IT, maintain effective relationships with solution vendors to ensure R&D short and long-term objectives are met within each platform, with an eye towards continuous improvement
project charter to clearly articulate the business challenge, benefits, and approach to affect positive information management change
Oversee the establishment and management of integrated project plans, timelines, resourcing requirements, and risk/issue management evaluations for all projects to ensure on-time, high-quality delivery
Ensure that the implementation or improvement of all GxP R&D Systems are properly documented to support business utilization and inspection readiness. Support system related inspections as required.
Identify, investigate, escalate (if necessary), and develop mitigation approaches to identified risks & issues, and/or to overcome any challenges to successful delivery
Manage and oversee the allocation, performance, and collaboration of internal & external project resources to ensure optimal delivery of R&D systems
Manage approved budget expenditures and funded resources to effectively deliver system needs on-time, to budget, and with high quality
Provide regular project status reports identifying progress, risks, mitigation strategies, and timelines for the benefit of stakeholders, leadership, and governance committees
Lead and/or contribute to working groups or teams formed to address areas of improvement within the R&D scope of operations
Ensure quality and oversight of delivery partners (DX,DSI IT etc) is in-line with expectations, with clear communication and escalation where needed
Lead or contribute to ad hoc projects or initiatives, as assigned responsibilities.
Business Analysis
Function as an experienced Business Systems Analyst within large projects or other appropriate situations, as assigned by the Global Business Systems Owner
Directly develop formal problem/opportunity statements, business cases, and project charters to clearly articulate the business challenge, benefits, and approach to affect positive information management change, as required
Provide business-focused project deliverables including – but, not limited to – process engineering or reengineering, user requirements definition, test scenario & test case development, user training, acceptance testing, and business support & administration
Relationships & Collaboration
Collaborate with other Global Development Information Mgmt. team members to work in a harmonized fashion across areas of specialization to support project and R&D objectives
Build and maintain close relationships with subject matter experts, information technology colleagues, business leads, vendors and external resources in executing projects or other initiatives
Contribute to System Roadmaps across assigned systems including current and planned release schedules and strategic investment direction
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education
Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Life Science, Engineering, Business Administration or a related discipline or equivalent work experience required
Master's Degree Life Sciences or Information Systems preferred
Years of Experience
Minimum of 10 years of experience within life sciences supporting the delivery of GXP validated global business systems serving cross-functional stakeholders is required
Demonstrated experience within or supporting Research & Development processes, roles and systems is required
Demonstrated industry experience of Planisware, Safety Vigilance and Data Lake business process adoption within a global pharmaceutical operating model is required
Demonstrated experience serving as the liaison between Business & IT, translating business needs into technical solutions and technical considerations into business language is required
Demonstrated experience managing R&D systems either on the IT or Business side is required
Excellent oral and written skills are required
Demonstrated experience involving data governance and/or data stewardship is preferred
Knowledge of key industry regulations relating to the compliance of IT Data and Systems is required
Proven ability to work in a global and highly matrixed environment is preferred
Experience supporting an audit/inspection of an IT system is preferred
Line Management experience of Business System Analysts, Project Managers and Business Process Engineers to deliver IT Projects is required  

Daiichi Sankyo, Inc. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: NGS Data Architect / IT Project Manager
description:
Description:**Overview**  
Tanaq Support Services (TSS) delivers professional, scientific, and technical services and information technology (IT) solutions to federal agencies in health, agriculture, technology, and other government services. TSS is a subsidiary of the St. George Tanaq Corporation (SGT), an Alaskan Native Corporation (ANC) committed to serving Federal customers while also giving back to the Tanaq native community and shareholders. SGT is privately owned by Alaska Natives, and stock is not publicly traded.  
**About the Role**  
We are looking for a **Next-generation sequencing (NGS) Data Architect / Information Technology (IT) Project Manager** to provide support to a Division at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).  
The NGS Data Architect / IT Project Manager will use their knowledge in technical aspects related to information architecture, software development, and usability and work with technical and functional leads to provide advice and support to the customer.  
**Responsibilities**  
**Information Technology Project Management**

* Provide project management services in support of IT and Business requirements.
* Accomplish assignments and delivery of IT services according to legal and regulatory requirements by utilizing advanced information technology principles, concepts, methods, standards, and practices.
* Utilize organizational knowledge, interpersonal and communications skills, and management techniques to translate technical expertise into policies and projects.
* Prepare and deliver briefings and presentations to encourage understanding and acceptance.
* Present recommendations effectively to management for acceptance and implementation and recommend ways to improve the effectiveness.
* Manage Information Management and organizational projects in a matrixed environment, from original concept through final implementation. Interface with all areas affected by the project, including end users, computer services, and client services, and define project scope and objectives.
* Develop detailed work plans, Work Breakdown Structures (WBS), project schedules, project estimates, resource plans, and status reports.
* Develop Earned Value Management (EVM) tools and procedures for managing project budgets at the program level.
* Oversee project-level risk management.
* Lead the implementation of new reporting procedures and project management best practices.
* Conduct project meetings and be responsible for project tracking and analysis.
* Ensure adherence to quality standards and review project deliverables.
* Assure compliance with the client's Enterprise Performance Life Cycle (EPLC) process.
* Prepare and review EPLC documents and support governance processes (e.g., Stage Gate Reviews).
* Manage the integration of vendor tasks, and track and review vendor deliverables.
* Provide technical and analytical guidance to the project team.
* Recommend and take action to direct the analysis and solutions of problems.
* Work with the client to identify, design, and develop innovative solutions to complex business scenarios while following the client’s software development, infrastructure, security, and compliance guidelines.

**Next-generation sequencing (NGS) Data Architecture**

* Provide expert technical advice, guidance, and recommendations to management and other technical specialists on critical IT issues.
* Work with various client organizations, technical and functional leads to provide advice and support to the client on developing data management plans.
* Assist with the establishment of and facilitate subsequent Data Management activities.
* Work with the client and provide advice and support on developing a high-level strategy for Data Management and Conversion that provides a roadmap for performing the migration of data from legacy systems to the new modernized system.
* Assist in the establishment of Data Security and Management Policies, Processes, and Procedures
* Ensure compliance with all Data Security mandates.
* Attend data conversion meetings, review products, ensure all data anomalies are addressed before migration to the new system and that reconciliation between systems, ledgers, etc. are completed.
* Attend all data management and conversion meetings. Provide meeting minutes, notes, briefs, etc., as required for stakeholders and management meetings.
* Support the client Data Management lead in the oversight and review of all data management plans and artifacts.
* Review plans developed by the client and support the implementation of data management, data cleansing, data dictionaries, data migration, data conversion, data archiving, backup and recovery plans, and products.
* Review component legacy system data and ensure an accurate understanding of the data elements, structures, and quality is recorded.
* Setup staging environments for data cleansing and conversion activities
* Assist Components in preparing for migration of legacy data into a new integrated financial, procurement, and asset management system, such as executing mock data conversions and cutover activities.
* Support Departmental and Component level Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Warehouse (DW) efforts in conjunction with third-party BI/DW offerings.
* Work with the Requirements lead to identify component reporting requirement.
* Work with the client to facilitate the design and development of report and query designs.
* Work with Functional Testing lead and provide advice to the client on the development of test scripts for reports and ensure the data is reported as expected.
* Work with the third-party provider to resolve and report defects and to test the report until all issues are resolved.
* Perform data mining and analysis.

Requirements:**Required Experience and Skills**

* Minimum 3-5 years of prior experience managing IT projects supporting client business and technology needs.
* In-depth knowledge of Jira is a top priority, including system architecture, configuration, customization, and administration. Proficiency in building integrated data systems in both cloud and cluster computing environments. Splunk familiarity is also preferred.
* Ability to plan and execute data migration strategy while ensuring data integrity; experience with scripting languages and automation tools to streamline tasks and workflows and to ensure no functionality is lost during the migration.
* Proficiency in monitoring and optimizing the performance of JIRA and Splunk, identifying issues, troubleshooting, and offering resolution.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to develop training materials, and work effectively with cross-functional teams, including security stewards, users, SMEs, and leadership across the agency.
* Familiarity with public health is strongly preferred; Familiarity with whole genome sequencing is strongly preferred; In-depth knowledge of database management best practices is a must.
* Mastery of a wide range of advanced information technology principles, concepts, methods, standards, and practices sufficient to accomplish assignments and delivery of IT services according to legal and regulatory requirements.
* Comprehensive knowledge of IT systems architecture and IT infrastructures, information management systems, information assurance, and data standards to support CDC’s informatics mission.
* Ability to provide expert technical advice, guidance, and recommendations to management and other technical specialists on critical IT issues.
* Must have a highly developed combination of organizational knowledge, interpersonal and communications skills, and management techniques to translate technical expertise into policies and projects.
* Advanced management and organizational knowledge principles, methods, practices, and techniques for developing, implementing, and evaluating health communications, information dissemination, and IT strategies.
* Superior presentation skills to deliver briefings and presentations to encourage understanding and acceptance.
* Skillfully communicate verbally and in writing to present recommendations effectively to management for acceptance and implementation and recommend ways to improve the effectiveness.
* Superior customer interface skills with an emphasis on customer communications.
* Team oriented with the ability to collaborate with various stakeholders.
* Ability to deliver on time and budget.
* Skilled in risk management.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience performing data management and database development activities
* Must have experience implementing, migrating, managing, and operating systems/applications in an enterprise cloud computing environment.
* Subject matter expertise in management and migration of client Cloud Service Providers, Microsoft Azure, and Amazon Web Services (AWS) is required.
* Experience utilizing ‘Splunk’ application is preferred.
* Must have excellent communication, analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to multi-task, with solid delegation and follow-through
* Ability to obtain and maintain government clearance.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Familiarity with whole genome sequencing (WGS) data, especially related to antimicrobial resistance and virulence genes, including quality measures, analysis, applications, and data management.
* Prior experience performing similar lead technical work for a federal government agency highly desired.
* Knowledge of division CDC/ATSDR and DHHS information technology and program goals, policies, regulations, and guidelines to make decisions or recommendations that significantly influence important policies or programs.
* Experience writing technical documentation, especially in relation to Cloud architecture
* Experience implementing, migrating, managing, and operating systems/applications in an enterprise cloud computing environment
* Knowledge and experience resolving security vulnerabilities
* Experience creating and presenting technical analysis, findings, and recommendations to leadership using MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

**Education and Training**

* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Informatics, Computational Biology or other relevant field with 5 years of related experience; or Master’s degree with 3 years of experience.

**Physical Requirements**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. May need to lift 25 pounds occasionally.

**Who We Are**  
Tanaq Support Services strives to deeply understand and analyze our clients’ vision, needs, and requirements so we may provide alternative solutions, empowering them to choose the best resolution. We aim to achieve excellence by delivering on our commitments to our clients, employees, and partners.  
TSS is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and participates in E-Verify. All employment decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Our policies provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic under federal, state, or local laws. For more information, visit Know Your Rights and Pay Transparency Statement.  
If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance completing any part of the application process, please email accommodation@tanaq.com to request a reasonable accommodation. This email is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.  
**To view more job opportunities with us, please visit**  
https://recruiting.paylocity.com/recruiting/jobs/All/a4712c9f-f074-40e8-9a14-bee06660bd81/Tanaq-Support-Services-LLC  
https://recruiting.paylocity.com/recruiting/jobs/All/6357ebaa-7c82-4e63-88fc-2fa1c293d1c0/Tanaq-Management-Services-LLC
